support_summary: ATXN3 promotes the progression of anaplastic thyroid carcinoma by directly stabilizing the protein EIF5A2.

functions.cellular_process: In the context of anaplastic thyroid carcinoma (ATC), ATXN3 directly interacts with the eukaryotic translation initiation factor 5A2 (EIF5A2). Through its deubiquitinase activity, ATXN3 removes ubiquitin chains from EIF5A2, thereby preventing its recognition and degradation by the proteasome.
functions.effect_description: This deubiquitination leads to the stabilization and subsequent accumulation of EIF5A2 protein. Elevated levels of EIF5A2, driven by ATXN3, are positively correlated with enhanced proliferation and metastasis of ATC cells. Both proteins are found to be overexpressed in ATC tissues.
biological_consequence: ATXN3 binds directly to EIF5A2 -> ATXN3 removes ubiquitin chains from EIF5A2 -> Proteasomal degradation of EIF5A2 is inhibited -> EIF5A2 protein accumulates -> ATC cell proliferation and metastasis are promoted
specific_effects: Directly reduces ubiquitination of EIF5A2, increasing its protein half-life.
ATXN3 and EIF5A2 protein levels are positively correlated in ATC tissues.
The ATXN3-EIF5A2 axis is identified as a pro-tumorigenic pathway in anaplastic thyroid carcinoma.

evidence.paper_title: The deubiquitinating enzyme ATXN3 promotes the progression of anaplastic thyroid carcinoma by stabilizing EIF5A2
evidence.relevant_quote: Mechanistically, ATXN3 promotes EIF5A2 expression by directly binding to EIF5A2 to reduce its ubiquitination and degradation.

mechanism: In the context of anaplastic thyroid carcinoma (ATC), ATXN3 directly interacts with the eukaryotic translation initiation factor 5A2 (EIF5A2). Through its deubiquitinase activity, ATXN3 removes ubiquitin chains from EIF5A2, thereby preventing its recognition and degradation by the proteasome.
effect: This deubiquitination leads to the stabilization and subsequent accumulation of EIF5A2 protein. Elevated levels of EIF5A2, driven by ATXN3, are positively correlated with enhanced proliferation and metastasis of ATC cells. Both proteins are found to be overexpressed in ATC tissues.
summary: ATXN3 activates EIF5A2 to modulate eif5a2 protein stabilization.

evidence.paper_title: The deubiquitinating enzyme ATXN3 promotes the progression of anaplastic thyroid carcinoma by stabilizing EIF5A2
evidence.relevant_quote: Mechanistically, ATXN3 promotes EIF5A2 expression by directly binding to EIF5A2 to reduce its ubiquitination and degradation.

pathways.name: Deubiquitination and Stabilization of Substrate Proteins
